name: Abhishek Magotra
location: O26A, Jangpura Extension, New Delhi 110017, India
bio:
He is a Registered Patent and Trademark Attorney with extensive experience in Intellectual Property prosecution since 2006. With an in-depth knowledge in the field of law and technology, Abhishek specializes in creating roadmaps for clients’ Research and Development activities.
His expertise includes advising clients to optimize their Research and Development activities, manage their Intellectual property portfolios including concept identification, decision Making, and protection of their Intellectual Property Rights. He advises clients on risk mitigating measures in carrying out research and development to ensure high predictability and least vulnerability in their business.
Abhishek has extensive experience in providing end-to-end solutions to clients in the field of Intellectual Property Rights. Apart from performing due diligence of clients’ Intellectual Property assets, he plays an important role in drafting, filing and prosecution processes of patent applications in India as well as in foreign jurisdictions. This includes international patent application filings and prosecution such as Paris Convention patent applications, PCT applications and related national stage patent applications. He is instrumental in handling oppositions before Indian patent offices, appeals, invalidation proceedings and litigation before Indian Courts.
Abhishek regularly conducts client and third-party portfolio review, complex freedom-to-operate studies, infringement and validity opinion and creates strategic plans for large and small scale companies.
Abhishek’s other areas of expertise include filing, prosecution and opposition challenges in respect of Industrial Designs and Trademarks apart from providing technology transfer strategy, commercialization, technical know-how, evaluation and valuation of Intellectual Property Rights. Abhishek also helps clients grow their Patent, Trademark and Industrial Design assets while advising them in peripherals like assignment, contracts and license agreements.

name: Aditya Kashyap

bio:
Dedicated legal professional with a passion for justice, social impact, and continuous learning. Currently practicing as an Advocate at the Supreme Court of India and the Delhi High Court. My expertise spans constitutional law, criminal law, and international human rights.

A graduate from National Law University, Punjab, I also served as the National Co-convenor of Think India for two terms. Post my graduation, I joined as a Law Researcher to Justice C D Singh at Delhi High Court for about 2 years. Thereafter, I worked at a litigation firm Karanjawala & Co. at Delhi. I am currently attached as an Associate to Mr Vikramjit Banerjee, Sr Advocate & Additional Solicitor General of India at the Supreme Court.

Since student days, I have been instrumental in filing cases, letter petitions and legal representations before constitutional and statutory authorities in public interest in a number of social and national causes. I frequently write on social, legal and political issues and contributes to the contemporary discourse. As an avid reader and researcher, my interest areas include Constitutional Law, Criminal Justice, IPR Law, Arthashashtra, Soft Power, and National Security.

bio:
Rohit Dandriyal is a leading advocate in Delhi, India. Established in 2015, the Chamber of Rohit Dandriyal is renowned for its excellence in criminal law practice. Mr. Dandriyal, a distinguished criminal lawyer in Delhi, actively practices at the Supreme Court of India, the High Court of Delhi, and all district courts in Delhi. He is particularly noted for his expertise in criminal trial proceedings, bail matters, and especially NDPS bail and trials.
His office is centrally located in Jungpura, Delhi, just 5 km from both the Supreme Court of India and the Delhi High Court. Mr. Dandriyal has been practicing criminal law primarily at the Delhi High Court and the Supreme Court of India since 2015.
The law office has an extensive practice primarily in Delhi, comprising eminent lawyers who meticulously identify and address clients’ needs. The firm believes that no case is indefensible and provides comprehensive legal services under criminal law, from the registration of criminal complaints as FIRs to various stages such as investigation, bail, charge, trial, appeal, and revision.
Our team is organized into four specialized tiers:
•⁠ ⁠Trial Court Team
•⁠ ⁠High Court Team
•⁠ ⁠Supreme Court Team
•⁠ ⁠Legal Research Team
We offer legal protection to clients from undue police harassment by obtaining stay orders, bail, anticipatory bail, and restraining orders from High Courts. Our firm assists clients at every level of trial as defense counsel, with each lawyer specializing in their respective fields and excelling in solution-oriented approaches. Our litigation practice spans every forum and area of law, tailored to meet the specific needs and requirements of our clients. Our core aim is to serve our clients and secure relief and justice for them within the bounds of the law. Criminal law practice remains our primary area of focus, with significant practice before the Supreme Court of India and High Courts across the country, particularly in Delhi, Uttarakhand, Rajasthan, Allahabad, Lucknow, Mumbai, and Chandigarh.

name: AJI V DEV
location: Aji V Dev & Associates, Room No.16, 4th Floor, Empire Building, Oppo: Central Police Station, Near High Court, Kombara, Ernakulam -682 018
bio:
I am Aji V. Dev, a practising lawyer in the High Court of Kerala, Ernakulam. I hail from Vallicodu- Kottayam a beautiful village near to Pathanamthitta in the Kerala state of India, where undulating hills decorated by tall trees and lush green vegetation descends to the paddy fields in a rhythmic way. The long journey started in 1964.
Having a middleclass background, growing up in such a habitat with my parents, two sisters, lot of cousins, friends and fairy tales was a wonderful experience, indeed. The memorabilia include my schooling there in the S.N.D.P. U.P School and N.S.S. High School. Studies continued on at Catholicate College, Pathanamthitta, N.S.S. College, Pandalam, Government Arts College, Thiruvananthapuram and School of Indian Legal Thought, the law department of the Mahatma Gandhi University, Kottayam. I earned my masters degree in Economics from the University of Kerala, Thiruvananthapuram and then earned another masters degree in Law from the Mahatma Gandhi University, Kottayam.
Eventually I shifted to Kottayam, a bustling town in south central Kerala, famous for its 3 L’s, Lakes, Latex and Letters, where I joined as an employee in the Mahatma Gandhi University, Kottayam in 1990. After having a short stay there, I relieved therefrom in 1992 to join as an Assistant Sales Tax Officer, with the Kerala State Sales Tax Department, now known as the State GST Department.  In 2012, when I was an Assistant Commissioner with the Department, in Ernakulam I took voluntary retirement leaving the balance service up to May, 2020 and started my practice as a lawyer and founded Aji V Dev & Associates, the lawyer firm in Ernakulam. I currently live in Ernakulam, Kochi, the “Queen of the Arabian Sea”. My passion for law, business, reading, writing, travelling and for motivational thinking is inherent. I am a regular or a frequent columnist in various magazines.

name: Akshat Hansaria

bio:
Akshat Hansaria co-heads the Commercial Litigation and Arbitration practice at Svarniti Law Offices. Akshat has more than 15 years of experience in the field of Commercial Litigation and Arbitration disputes. He completed his law (B.A. LLB (Hons.)) from Amity Law School, New Delhi, and his Master of Laws (LLM) in International Business Laws from London School of Economic and Political Science, London.
Akshat focus’ on multiple practice areas in commercial litigation and arbitration, both domestic as well as international commercial arbitration, insolvency, regulatory, employment.
He has represented clients in automotive, banking, civil aviation, defence, household goods and services, infrastructure, pharmaceutical, oil and gas, power, telecom sectors etc. He has also represented clients in high stake arbitrations involving not only large Indian conglomerates but also International companies from various countries, including, Canada, France, Japan, Italy, Netherlands, South Africa, Singapore, South Korean and others.
He has represented clients in various fora across the country, including, the Supreme Court of India, the High Courts at Delhi, Bombay, Madras, Kolkata, Hyderabad, Allahabad, Ahmedabad, Bangalore, Kochi, Guwahati; various Tribunals, including the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal, National Company Law Tribunals at Delhi and Hyderabad etc.
His clientele does not only include Indian companies but also include large foreign conglomerates such as American Pharmaceutical Company, Canadian Telecom Company, French Energy Management Company, German Automotive Company, Japanese Pharmaceutical Company, Italian Oil and Gas Company, South African Pharmaceutical Company, South Korean Household Products Company etc.
Akshat also has extensive regulatory experience before various Tribunals, including Central Administrative Tribunal, National Green Tribunal, Telecom Disputes Settlement and Appellate Tribunal, Appellate Tribunal for Electricity and others.

bio:

Chairman-Cum-Managing Director, Patel – L&T, among others, which have set significant legal precedents. A former Assistant Advocate General for the State of Punjab, Alankar has adeptly handled matters before the Hon’ble Punjab and Haryana High Court, Chandigarh. His commitment to delivering innovative legal solutions is matched by his entrepreneurial acumen, having previously founded a legal services startup catering to over 500 clients globally.
Alankar’s passion for the law is complemented by his thought leadership, where he actively engages with the legal community through discussions on contemporary issues. Under his stewardship, Narula & Narula Law Offices has grown into a dynamic and client-centric practice, celebrated for its integrity and excellence.

name: Anirudh Krishnan
location: Chennai
bio:
“Anirudh Krishnan of AK Law Chambers is widely viewed as a prominent figure in the market, with commentators describing him as “technically able, with a sharp mind.” He is admired for his adept handling of both litigation and arbitration work.”– Chambers and Partners, Asia Pacific, 2019
“Thomas Williams, a London-based barrister and partner at Womble Bond Dickinson, describes Anirudh Krishnan, founding partner of AK Law Chambers in Chennai, as an “exceptional lawyer of the highest intellect and integrity”. Sentiments echoed by Baiju Vasani, a London-based partner at Jones Day, who applauds Krishnan, for being “highly experienced, sharp, creative problem solver”- India Business Law Journal’s- The ‘A’ List, India’s top 100 lawyers of 2018
“Anirudh Krishnan of AK Law Chambers is highly regarded as an “arbitration specialist” and admired by interviewees because “he spends time on the matters, conducts his own research and studies the issues in depth before presenting the legal strategy.” His ability to “deconstruct complex issues within a short time” and increasingly impressive “courtroom presentation and thinking on his feet” also attract high praise.” – Chambers and Partners, Asia-Pacific, 2018
“According to sources, Anirudh Krishnan of AK Law Chambers “has already earned an immense reputation at such a young age, and has a very bright future ahead of him.” He has a broad practice, earning particular praise for his “vast knowledge of international commercial arbitration,” as well as his “business savvy and strategy.” Lately he advised Shapoorji Pallonji & Co in a litigation and SIAC arbitration over a USD15.5 million contract for the construction and development of residential and commercial towers in Bengaluru.“- Chambers and Partners, Asia Pacific, 2016
Anirudh Krishnan of AK Law Chambers attracts a raft of praise for his arbitration and litigation expertise. Peers describe him as “a rising star with great potential.” He lately acted for Adam & Coal Resources in Supreme Court litigation against a Swiss trading company, concerning the repayment of monies owed. Interviewees praise his solutions-oriented approach, stating: “He’s so creative, he always gives the client several options.” “– Chambers and Partners, Global
“AK Law Chambers’ founder partner, Anirudh Krishnan, was a consultant to an expert panel constituted by the Law Commission of India to deliberate on the proposed reforms to arbitration law in India. The commission’s report states that input given by him and another expert was “incisive, vital and require special appreciation.”– Indian Business Law Journal
Anirudh Krishnan is the founder partner of AK Law Chambers. Being a law graduate from NALSAR, Hyderabad, and completed the BCL course from Oxford University, Anirudh is also a qualified Solicitor of England and Wales. He handles commercial and public law litigation, arbitration and corporate advisory work of the firm.
His expertise in the field of domestic and international arbitration emerges from the authoritative two-volume book titled “Justice R.S. Bachawat’s Law of Arbitration and Conciliation” published by LexisNexis Butterworths Wadhwa Nagpur, of which he is the Chief-Editor and has contributed chapters in the international publications- “Handbook on Third-Party Funding in International Arbitration” and “CPR India Supplement”.
During his stint at Clifford Chance, London, he has worked in among other areas on international arbitration and commercial litigation. He has been part of teams that have been involved in numerous arbitrations including ICC, LCIA, SIAC, AMTAC and ICSID arbitrations in addition to a number of domestic arbitrations. He has also acted on behalf of numerous corporates and Public Sector Undertakings before Indian courts. Anirudh has been empanelled as arbitrator with Nani Palkhiwala Arbitration Centre and has been appointed by the Chief Justice of the Madras High Court as an arbitrator.

bio:
Astha Garg, Co-Founder of Revolute Law, boasts an illustrious career thus far representing clients across sectors and foras. Astha is an alumna of Vasant Valley School, Delhi, and the Symbiosis International University, Pune, and is an active member of the Symbiosis Alumni Women Network.
From representing waqf tenants before the Delhi High Court to representing the Government of India in one of the largest ongoing international commercial arbitrations in the oil and gas sector, Astha’s career represents her massive knowledge base in the sphere of commercial litigation and arbitration. A firm believer in the power of negotiation, Astha is not just an astute litigator but an effective negotiator. Outside the office, Astha is an avid reader, keen artist, and amateur photographer. She loves traveling to unexplored locations and experiencing life as the locals do. She believes that new experiences make one a well-rounded individual better suited to represent individuals from different walks of life.
Her keen business acumen and dedication to client success make her an invaluable asset to organizations seeking legal guidance.

bio:
Ayush Kalpasi is a seasoned media lawyer and intellectual property (IP) expert with a rich background in music law and entertainment rights. With years of hands-on experience representing artists, creators, and businesses, he is a trusted advocate for those navigating the intricate legal landscape of the media and entertainment industry.
Having worked with A-list artists and leading labels like Sony Music and Universal Music, Mr. Kalpasi brings a deep understanding of the nuances involved in safeguarding creative works and negotiating contracts. His expertise spans across media and entertainment law, music licensing, trademark protection, and IP portfolio management.
His dedication to the creative community extends beyond legal counsel; he has been running a free consultancy service to educate artists about their IP rights, helping them retain control over their creations. As a professional who blends legal acumen with a passion for empowering creators, Mr. Kalpasi has also worked closely with startups, businesses, and music publishing agencies, offering practical solutions tailored to their unique challenges.
In addition to his work in India, Mr. Kalpasi collaborates with international organizations, managing complex legal agreements and navigating global music licensing frameworks. Expanding his practice further, he is also actively working in the field of US Personal Injury Law, adding another dimension to his expertise. This international scope complements his IP work, which inherently operates on a global scale.
Whether it’s drafting robust contracts, protecting intellectual property, or guiding clients through licensing negotiations, Mr. Kalpasi is a pioneer media lawyer committed to excellence and innovation.

He has helped brands to create their trade marks/brand names and assisted their marketing teams in preparing brand strategies. Moreover, he has successfully negotiated deals ranging from associations with giant alcohol brands to representing artists before music distributors and labels during their album/song releases.
On the academic front, Mr. Sivaramakrishnan has featured in webinars and online forums, where he was seen sharing his experiences with young legal minds and providing them with an open understanding of the field. He has also conducted seminars in colleges to provide a unique perspective on IPR in today’s time.
Siva’s expertise was well-recognized, when he was credited as the legal advisor for a feature film. He works closely with Bollywood singers, musicians and publishers to understand the current status of royalties and benefits for artists in the music industry.

Her litigation advisory and representation practice includes devising strategies with resource-optimised outcomes, Drafting/ review and filing of Misc Applications, Petitions, Appeals, Affidavits, Replies, Rejoinders before NCLT, NCLAT, High Court, DRT, Consumer Courts, Supreme Court and preparing Counters and legal research on relevant cases.
She also advises on compliances for companies across sectors such as manufacturing (textiles, metals, auto), pharma and healthcare, insurance, banks and NBFCs, construction, energy, real estate, e-commerce among others. Negotiating and drafting commercial agreements relating to, inter-alia, Mergers/ Acquisition are also within her scope.
She regularly appears in forums such as NCLT/NCLAT, MSME, DRT, RERA and Consumer Court in addition to the High Court.
The volume and versatility of legal work that she has executed has lended itself to timelines that are against the clock. she believes in weaving in quality checks consistently, through fast paced dispute resolution, advisory and compliance.

location: P-93, Lower Ground Floor, CR Park, New Delhi-110019
bio:
Raghumanyu is a first-generation lawyer. He has a mixed PQE of more than 4 years in the field of law, policy, and politics. After completing 20 internships in law school including a semester exchange via AIESEC to Cairo, Egypt, he joined the Chambers of Mr. Jai A Dehadrai, Standing Counsel for the Union of India at the Hon'ble Supreme Court as a litigation counsel.

After completing a little less than 2 years, he wanted to professionally assist politicians and market their campaigns and joined I-PAC as a core team member of the Political Intelligence Unit. He was a part of the campaign team that led the TMC flag for the Goa assembly elections in 2021.

He then decided to work as a public policy consultant with a notable think tank, 'Bridge' in Delhi. As the MCD elections in Delhi were around the corner, he left his job and decided to assist Mr. Kunwar Arjun Singh Pal Marwah with the upcoming elections which unfortunately got postponed. After the MCD elections were notified to be held in December 2022, he decided to manage Mr. Marwah's campaign and led him to victory from the Lajpat Nagar ward (Ward-144) making Mr. Marwah the youngest BJP Councilor.

At present, he is pursuing counsel practice after having worked with Human Elevation as a full time consultant after completing a judicial clerkship with Hon’ble Mr. Justice Saurabh Banerjee at the Hon'ble High Court of Delhi.

He has been the lead anchor for the Indian Red Cross Society whereby he went to different schools and colleges and taught the youth the ill effects of drug abuse. He is a core team member of Sarvahitey, NGO where he has actively steered Project Paper Bridge (an ambitious project of opening 1000 libraries across the remotest parts of India) (https://www.sarvahitey.org/paper-bridge).

He is also an accredited Mediation Counsel from the Standing Conference of Mediation Advocates, SCMA, London, UK, and truly believes that with the new mediation bill, the landscape of mediation in India will change for good.

He is also the founding partner at Scriboard®; He is the author of Guide to Cyber Laws: the Information Technology Act, 2000, E-Commerce, Data Protection and the Internet, the first section-wise analysis of the Indian Information Technology Act, 2000. He is presently Advisor to the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology, Government of India on the implementation of the Information Technology Act, 2000. Mr. Ryder has been nominated as a ‘Leading Lawyer’ in intellectual property, technology, communications and media law by Asia Law, Who’sWhoLegal, Asia Legal 500, amongst other International publications. Mr. Ryder is also advisor to the Data Security Council of India [a NASSCOM initiative] on the structuring of industry data privacy and information security policies and contractual standards. His second book, Intellectual Property and the Internet, published by LexisNexis is perhaps the only one of its kind in Asia. The text has been acknowledged to be an authoritative work by the Hon’ble Supreme Court of India and has been quoted in the first and only judgement by the Hon’ble Supreme Court of India on domain names. He is advisor to the National Internet Exchange of India [NiXI] and a member of the panel of independent and neutral arbitrators with NiXI.

Mr. Sinha’s powerful way of speaking and drafting has been pivotal in many cases. Notably, in 2022, he also played an important role where the Hon'ble High Court lifted the ban on 14-wheel trucks, demonstrating his ability to handle complex legal issues and effect meaningful change.
Beyond his courtroom successes, Rounak has undertaken several initiatives aimed at promoting social justice and public welfare. His dedication to these causes has led to invitations as a speaker at esteemed platforms, including the Bureau of Indian Standards and the Consumer Education & Research Centre, where he shares his insights and advocates for consumer rights and standards.

Hon’ble Bombay High Court is pleased to refer cases to her for Mediation as well as for Arbitration. Ujwala is empaneled as an Arbitrator with Indian Institute of Arbitration and Mediation (IIAM). With commerce background she has handled settlement cases skillfully. Ujwala is neutral and believes in win-win situation of the parties.

bio:
When legal matters escalate beyond the trial court level, having an experienced and reputed High Court lawyer becomes essential. Hyderabad, being the seat of the Telangana High Court, is home to some of the finest legal minds. Whether it is a writ petition, criminal appeal, quashing of FIR, or civil revision, the right legal representation can make all the difference.
At Arya Law Network, led by Advocate Md Yakub Ali, we bring more than a decade of experience in handling complex High Court matters. Known for our strategic litigation, sharp drafting, and personalized legal attention, we are proud to be counted among the famous High Court lawyers in Hyderabad.
👨‍⚖️ Why You Need a High Court Lawyer in Hyderabad
High Court practice is highly specialized. It involves deep knowledge of not only substantive laws like civil, criminal, and constitutional law but also procedural laws such as the CPC, CrPC, and writ jurisdiction.
Here’s why hiring a High Court advocate is essential:
✅ Jurisdiction Expertise: The Telangana High Court has original and appellate jurisdiction — handling writs, appeals, and revisions.
✅ Time-sensitive Matters: Injunctions, bail applications, and stay orders must be filed swiftly and strategically.
✅ Advanced Drafting: Petitions, counter-affidavits, and rejoinders must meet strict formatting and legal standards.
✅ Courtroom Experience: Arguing in the High Court requires deep familiarity with judges' practices, procedures, and legal precedent.
At Arya Law Network, we have successfully handled all of the above — earning the confidence of clients across Telangana and beyond.
⚖️ Advocate Md Yakub Ali – Legal Experience That Matters
With over 10 years of legal practice, Advocate Md Yakub Ali is a regular practitioner at the Telangana High Court, appearing in both civil and criminal matters, including:
Writ Petitions (W.P.): Against illegal government action, service matters, land acquisition, and education-related issues
Civil Appeals & Revisions: Challenging district court judgments and interlocutory orders
Quashing Petitions (Section 482 CrPC): For FIRs and criminal proceedings without merit
Bail Matters: Anticipatory and regular bail in serious criminal cases
Public Interest Litigation (PIL): Where justice affects a larger group or public interest
He is respected not only for legal strategy and oral arguments but also for ethical practice and deep client empathy.
